title: Compliance-Native LIMS Platform
description: Designed and led development of a laboratory information management system with built-in HIPAA/SOC2 compliance controls.
fullDescription: A modern LIMS platform built with compliance as a first-class concern, not an afterthought. Features include automated audit logging, role-based access control, and built-in validation workflows.
problem: Existing LIMS solutions treated compliance as an add-on, leading to audit failures and security vulnerabilities.
constraints: Must support HIPAA, SOC2, and CLIA requirements. Zero tolerance for data integrity issues.
approach: Architected with compliance patterns embedded at the data layer. Built immutable audit logs and automated compliance reporting.
tradeoffs: Chose PostgreSQL over NoSQL for ACID compliance. Accepted slower development velocity for comprehensive test coverage.
execution: 12-month MVP with 5 engineers. Achieved SOC2 Type II certification within 6 months of launch.
outcomes: SOC2 Type II certified, serving 15+ laboratory clients, zero compliance findings in external audits.
whatIdImprove: Would start with a more modular architecture to support faster feature development post-compliance certification.
